medical_history.chief_complaint: Familial male-limited precocious puberty with elevated testosterone and inhibin B levels.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began in boys aged 2 to 6 years, characterized by rapid growth, bone age maturation, and progressive virilization, with sustained elevated levels of testosterone and inhibin B noted throughout follow-up.
medical_history.past_medical_history: All patients harbored mutations M398T or I542L in the LH receptor gene; treatment with ketoconazole was initiated to manage elevated testosterone levels.
medical_history.family_history: Patients are from three families with a reported genetic predisposition to familial male-limited precocious puberty.
